title: Piriformis Syndrome Treatment
content: Piriformis syndrome involves sciatic nerve compression by the piriformis muscle. Treatment includes piriformis stretching exercises, manual therapy techniques, and modification of aggravating activities. NSAIDs and muscle relaxants may provide symptomatic relief. Botulinum toxin or corticosteroid injections into the piriformis muscle are options for refractory cases. Surgical release is rarely indicated but may be considered for anatomical anomalies.
